alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia and Manzano Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 02 at 3:21PM MDT until May 04 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY EVENING FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY, SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS, CENTRAL HIGHLANDS, EAST CENTRAL PLAINS, NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS, AND NORTHEAST PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .An incoming upper level disturbance will allow for winds to strengthen in the presence of intruding dry air. Minimum relative humidity will fall into the low double digits, with localized single digits possible and southwest winds will increase Thursday afternoon, with gusts to 40 mph possible. Instability will also be on the rise as the system pushes inland, with Haines 5 and 6 becoming widespread. In addition, lightning activity from today and tomorrow over receptive fuel beds may lead to new ignitions. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Thursday afternoon through Thursday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Middle Rio Grande Valley (106), Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124), Central Highlands (Zone 125), East Central Plains (Zone 126), Northeast Highlands (Zone 123), and Northeast Plains (104) for Thursday afternoon through early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West-southwest at 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...8 to 14 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia and Manzano Mountains
